description: I co-founded a 501(c)(3) non-profit online STEM school that offers courses in Math, Physics, Biology, and Astronomy. As program coordinator, I conducted outreach campaigns to recruit over 50 qualified high school and college students, reaching over 1,500 students from 40+ countries. Furthermore, I headed book publishing and delivery; managed finances; directed web design; organized partnerships and acquired $15k in sponsorships; and coordinated school-wide events such as competitions and guest lectures from professors and industry leaders.

As a Head Coach for Redwood Middle Schoolâ€™s Math Club, I created a comprehensive 3-year rotating curriculum covering advanced topics in Algebra, Geometry, Combinatorics, and Number Theory. As Liaison, I organized club events and contest participation and facilitated communication between administrators, volunteers, parents and students. I was also a founding member for our local MATHCOUNTS Chapter (South Santa Clara Valley) and served as the lead coordinator for testing logistics, proctoring, and grading for 12 local middle schools.

As president of a volunteer chapter with 150+ members, I organized guest speaker and charity events. As a volunteer, I served as a STEM project designer and lead at the Sunday Friends low-income community center by engaging K-6 students in math through origami and setting up a computer system with a database of math problems.
